meaning_str.bing:
adj. 使人害羞的（或难堪的、惭愧的）；使显得愚蠢的（或不诚实的等）
v. “embarrass”的现在分词
网络. 令人尴尬的；令人为难的；令人难堪的

使人害羞的（或难堪的、惭愧的）；使显得愚蠢的（或不诚实的等）
令人尴尬的；令人为难的；令人难堪的

令人尴尬的；使人难堪的（或害羞的、惭愧的）；令人窘迫的；使人困窘的；令人不舒服的；令人为难的；尴尬的；难堪的
使窘迫；使尴尬；使困窘；使难堪；使为难；使困惑；使陷入困境；（embarrass的现在分词）

1.en: He had no reasons for anything but gratitude towards her, he owed her his happiness, and yet, it was embarrassing to him to meet her.
1.cn: 他对她原只怀着感激的心情，他今天的幸福是从她那里得来的，可是遇见她总不免有些尴尬。

2.en: It was embarrassing for him to bump into one of his ex- girlfriends last night.
2.cn: 昨天晚上撞见其中一个前女友真是让他尴尬。

3.en: The breaking of a taboo is usually upsetting or embarrassing for the person concerned .
3.cn: 打破禁忌经常会令相关的人生气或尴尬。

0.en: Higher or lower than what? This is embarrassing.
0.cn: 什么东西向上或是向下？

1.en: Okay, babe. Kind of embarrassing me in front of my friends.
1.cn: 好吧，宝贝儿，你让我在朋友面前有些难堪。

2.en: No! Go away. You're embarrassing me in front of 8-year-olds. Sorry.
2.cn: 没有！走开啦，你让我在一群8岁小孩面前丢脸了。抱歉。

3.en: America, what you done to these Koreans? This is a little embarrassing.
3.cn: 美国人，看看你对这些北韩人做了些什么？真让我觉得羞耻。

4.en: She really needs to tone down on the social niceties. It's embarrassing.
4.cn: 她真该改改她的大小姐脾气，搞的挺尴尬的。

5.en: So? Well, it's embarrassing. People were looking at us like we were crazy.
5.cn: 所以呢？很尴尬，别人都当我们是疯子。

6.en: It's gonna be really embarrassing. You? My dad is on his belated honeymoon.
6.cn: 这下真的太尴尬了。你呢？我爸爸正在度蜜月。

7.en: Oh, that's right. He called to ask out Monica. That's gotta be embarrassing.
7.cn: 原来如此，他是要约莫妮卡，真是尴尬。

8.en: Wow. This is kind of embarrassing. I was actually coming over to talk to your friend.
8.cn: 这真的是很尴尬，事实上，我想跟你朋友说话。

9.en: Oh hey, no, you're not welcome. Okay, look, I hate this. You guys keep embarrassing me.
9.cn: 这里不欢迎你，我讨厌这样，你们害我拼命出丑。

10.en: Oh, this is very embarrassing. Dr. Lorvis, I am so sorry. I did not mean to lead you on.
10.cn: 这太尴尬了，乐维斯医生，真的很抱歉，我不是故意让你误会的。

11.en: You'll be forcing him out of his job, embarrassing him, making him come to you to apologize.
11.cn: 你将逼他离职，让他难堪，逼他跟你道歉。

12.en: Mummy, she believes the other dress is for her. Poor, slow, little Cinders. How embarrassing.
12.cn: 妈咪，她以为多出来的那礼服是给她的呢。可怜又迟钝的灰姑娘啊。多么尴尬啊！

13.en: Leslie? No, no. What, are you kidding? He asked her out once. It was an embarrassing failure.
13.cn: 莱斯利？没有，怎么可能？他约过她一次，不过尴尬地失败了。

14.en: My marriage fell apart within a year, something that was really embarrassing and painful at the time.
14.cn: 一年不到，我的婚姻就以失败告终了。

15.en: I suffered an unfortunate series of embarrassing incidents. I just want a wine bath and to go to sleep.
15.cn: 我不幸遭遇了一连串尴尬事件。我只想喝点小酒泡个澡去睡觉。

16.en: But no, okay. No, no, I can see why running with me would be embarrassing to you. Yeah, okay. You're uptight.
16.cn: 但是好吧，难怪你会觉得跟我跑步很尴尬，你很保守。

17.en: Oh, Okay. This is very embarrassing, but I think you've got me confused with a panda named Lotus. My name is Po.
17.cn: 好吧，这下有点尴尬了，我想你认错儿子了，我不叫莲花，我叫阿宝。

18.en: He wasn't? All right. Well, this is embarrassing. Because I had a long conversation with someone who I thought was Tam.
18.cn: 他没来吗？好吧。这就尴尬了。因为我跟一位我以为是丹的人聊了可久了。

19.en: No, you know what? I'm sorry. I really shouldn't have said that you were embarrassing me, I mean that really wasn't cool.
19.cn: 我才抱歉，我不该说你丢我的脸，那样很过份。
